title: How to Enable a Keyboard on PC or Mac

steps.title: Click the menu.
steps.content: Click the menu. It’s at the top-left corner of the screen.

steps.title: Click System Preferences.
steps.content: Click System Preferences .

steps.title: Click Accessibility.
steps.content: Click Accessibility . It’s the blue circle with the outline of a person inside.

steps.title: Click Keyboard.
steps.content: Click Keyboard .

steps.title: Click the Accessibility Keyboard tab.
steps.content: Click the Accessibility Keyboard tab.

steps.title: Check “Enable Accessibility Keyboard” box.
steps.content: Check “Enable Accessibility Keyboard” box. The accessibility keyboard is now enabled.

steps.title: Click the Search icon.
steps.content: Click the Search icon. It’s usually a magnifying glass or white circle next to the Start menu. If you don’t see these icons, press ⊞ Win + S .

steps.title: Type keyboard.
steps.content: Type keyboard . A list of search results will appear.

steps.title: Click On-Screen Keyboard.
steps.content: Click On-Screen Keyboard . It should be near the top of the search results.

steps.title: Slide the “On-Screen Keyboard” keyboard to .
steps.content: Slide the “On-Screen Keyboard” keyboard to . This opens the on-screen keyboard. You can use this keyboard by clicking the mouse (or tapping the touchscreen) on the key you want to type.

steps.title: Right-click the part of the taskbar with the clock.
steps.content: Right-click the part of the taskbar with the clock. It’s usually at the bottom-right corner of the screen. A menu will appear.

steps.title: Click Show touch keyboard button.
steps.content: Click Show touch keyboard button . This adds a small keyboard icon to the area by the clock. If you have a lot of icons in this area, click the arrow to display the icons you can’t see.

steps.title: Click the keyboard icon.
steps.content: Click the keyboard icon. This opens the touch keyboard. You can now use your touchscreen to type.

steps.title: Click the Search icon.
steps.content: Click the Search icon. It’s usually a magnifying glass or white circle next to the Start menu. If you don’t see these icons, press ⊞ Win + S .

steps.title: Type region.
steps.content: Type region . A list of results will appear.

steps.title: Click Region & Language.
steps.content: Click Region & Language . It should be the first match.

steps.title: Click + Add a language.
steps.content: Click + Add a language . A list of languages will appear.

steps.title: Click the language you want to enable.
steps.content: Click the language you want to enable. This downloads the language and adds it to the Languages list.

steps.title: Click the language you just downloaded.
steps.content: Click the language you just downloaded. It’s under the “Languages” header. Some buttons will appear.

steps.title: Click Options.
steps.content: Click Options .

steps.title: Click Download.
steps.content: Click Download . The keyboard for this language will download to the computer. When it’s finished installing, you’ll be prompted to restart the computer.

steps.title: Restart your computer.
steps.content: Restart your computer. Click the , click , then click Restart . The computer will turn off and then turn back on.

steps.title: Switch the keyboard to the new language.
steps.content: Switch the keyboard to the new language. Now when you need to switch languages, press and hold ⊞ Win and the Spacebar to bring up the language list, then click the language you want to use.

steps.title: Plug the keyboard cord into the computer’s USB port.
steps.content: Plug the keyboard cord into the computer’s USB port. If you plugged the keyboard in and it was not automatically detected, unplug the cable, then plug it back in.

steps.title: Open the Device Manager.
steps.content: Open the Device Manager. If the keyboard is still not detected, type device manager into the search bar, then click Device Manager in the search results.

steps.title: Right-click Keyboards.
steps.content: Right-click Keyboards . A context menu will appear.

steps.title: Click Scan for hardware changes.
steps.content: Click Scan for hardware changes . This scans the computer for new keyboards. Once your keyboard is detected, the appropriate drivers will be installed.
